text: you
fifteen years ago I was going through my
parents record
collection as many teenagers do I was
struck by one record in particular
mainly because of the cover art which
featured a folksy looking raccoon
leaning on a cane the record was called
naturally and it was made by someone
named JJ Cale I was fascinated by his
voice hazy and dim buried down in the
mix wait I've heard the song on the
radio but it was Leonard Skynyrd playing
the song
another one sounded familiar too after
midnight Wigan metal
you've been performed by Eric Clapton
kales was the sound of the prototype the
original 15 years after my initial
discovery on July 26 2013
juju kale died at the age of 74 I went
to talk to Jason Berlin D publisher of
the fretboard Journal a guitar magazine
when you hear dire straits when you hear
Eric Clapton when you hear meal young
you hear John Mayer even you can pick up
on the influence JJ Hale had on the
music that weird cool fusion between
rock and country and blues and folk is
all there and even though his records
aren't the most popular thing in the
world right now he's influenced some of
the most popular music of all time Jason
told me to talk to JJ Cale's friend and
guitar maker Danny Farrington I asked
Danny y JJ Cal never became a superstar
like so many of his songs had song crazy
mama from that same record from
naturally was a hit and so they wouldn't
play American Bandstand so he shows up
you know he's got his band all these
guys from Oklahoma and they start
setting their equipment up and the
director comes out and says you know you
guys you don't need to plug those
guitars in because we just use the
record Kael said I know but we know how
to play it it'll sound just like the
record they said no you don't understand
we don't do it like that
we just lip-synching Cal said I'm not
going to do that he rolls his chords up
sticks them in his amp starts loading
them in the truck well someone tells
Dick Clark he runs down frantic cuz Cale
is leaving he's not going to be on the
show
he says JJ your song will be number one
when it's on American Bandstand
and he'll said I don't care he was a
musician he played music he was going to
act like he was playing music that kind
of got killed us they don't make them
like him anymore
